result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Pirtle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with same conditions of probations as stated in 13CF279.

Amended JOC to 24 months probation
Disbursements Journal Final.

8:42 a.m. Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard today are 14CF437, 14CF438, 13CF279, 14CF284.
State has complied with the vicitim notifications.  Victim H. C. of 13CF279 is present in Court today.
Amended Information for 13CF279 is filed in the Court adding Count 5 Battery and add repeater enhancers to each count.
Amended Complaint description information for adding Count 5.
Amended Information for 14CF284 is filed in Court dropping Dangerous Weapon enhancers for each 4 counts and Amending Count 2 from Felony Bail Jumping down to Misd. Bail Jumping and repeater enhancers remain.
Atty Gardner concurs with amendments and waives readings.
________
DA Molepski states the plea agreements.
13CF279 Count 1: I/S Sentence: Prison at 24 mo Incarceration and 36 mo Extended Supervision - Stayed
36 mo Probation:
Conditions:
Defendant not to commit any new crimes. 
1 yr jail with 303 days credit.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Sign releases for Agent.
Restitution TBD.
No contact with victims J.N., A.S., and S.S..
$1,000 fine + costs.
Participate in an Alternative Agression course as approved by the Agent.
13CF279 Added Count 5: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation, same conditions as Count 1, $200 + costs.
13CF279 Counts 2, 3, & 4 to be DRI.
-------
14CF284: Amended Count 2:  W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation: Costs. Same conditions.
14CF284: Count 3: I/S Sentence:  90 days jail, consecutive-stayed:  36 mo Probation: $100 + costs.
14CF284: Counts 1 & 4 to be DRI.
_______
14CF437 and 14CF438: to be DRI.
_______
Atty Gardner concurs except for jail credit is believed to be 342 days and may argue that time served in 13CF279 for jail sentence and that probation would be concurrent.
______________________________________________
Court notes that Arraignments need to be done on 14CF437 and 14CF438:
14CF437 and 14CF438: Arraignments are held:
State files Information for each case.
Defendant received copy of each case's information.
Defendant waives reading of each case's information. 
Defendant stand mute for each.
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered by the Court for each case.
________________________
Plea Hearings for 13CF279 & 14CF284.

Plea questionnaire/Agreements are filed, Court reviews, correction as agreed by parties is accepted by the Court.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF279 Counts 1:  No Contest
13CF279 Added Count 5: No Contest

14CF284 Amended Count 2:  No Contest
14CF284 Count 3: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of: 
13CF279 Count 1
13CF279 Added Count  5
14CF284 Amended Count 2
14CF284 Count 3
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

14CF437, 14CF438, 13CF279 Counts 2, 3, & 4, and 14CF284 Counts 1 & 4 are Dismissed and Read In.

DA Molepski makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Gardner concurs with joint recommendation and makes sentencing arguments to the Court and requests 
342 days credit as a condition of probation as time served and 13CF279 Count 1 requests $500 fine + costs. Bond on file to be applied and extra returned to poster. 
Parties stipulate to 342 days jail credit.
Defendant makes apologetic statements and is in support of the recommendation.

********************************************
By The Court Sentencing:  ***PROBATION***
13CF279:  940.19(2) - Felony Substantial Battery - Count 1:
I/S Sentence: Prison at 2 yrs Incarceration and 2 yrs Extended Supervision - Stayed
3 yrs Probation:
Conditions:
342 days jail with 342 days credit already served.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Sign releases for Agent.
Restitution TBD.  State has 30 days to submit a restitution order with copies to be forward to all parties, if objections, must file written objection w/in 30 days pursuant to statutes and a hearing to be heard by Court Commissioner.
No contact with victims Jared Nease, Shannon Schulist or Amanda Schulist.
Participate in an Alternative Agression course as approved by the Agent.
$500 fine + costs.  Bond to be applied to fines/cost and is not to be applied to restitution - if extra return to poster.

13CF279:  940.19(1) - Misd. Battery - Added Count  5: 
I/S Sentence: 30 days Jail, consecutive to Count 1 - stayed
36 mo Probation, concurrent
Comply with the same conditions as Count 1.
Pay fine $200 + costs.

14CF284:  946.49(1)(a) - Misd. Bail Jump - Amended Count 2: 
I/S Sentence: 30 days Jail - stayed, consecutive to 13CF279
36 mo Probation, concurrent 
Comply with the same conditions as state in 13CF279.
Pay costs.

14CF284:  940.19(1)  - Misd. Battery - Count 3: 
I/S Sentence:  90 days jail, consecutive to Count 2 - stayed:  
36 mo Probation, concurrent
Comply with the same conditions as state in 13CF279.
Pay fine $100 + costs.
_________
Explaination of Written Determinate sentence is provided.
Appeal rights are stated on the record.
for Admission of State by Defendant Pursuant to Sec. 971.31(3), Wis. Stats.
State's
Jury trial - 12 person on January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 13CF279, 14CF284

11:14 a.m.   Court calls the case. 
13CF279 - 
1) Motion for expert testimony of Dr. Vader is addressed.
Atty Molepske makes arguments in support of the motion. 
Atty Gardner makes arguments in opposition of the motion. 

BY THE COURT:  Court allows the testimony subject to relevancy and any other evidentiary issue but will not exclude this evidence.  Is relevant to the injury and if it occurred and is consistent with the way it would have been described as occuring.  Motion is granted. Subject to objection at trial. 

2) Motion for expert testimony of Dr. Smith is addressed.
Atty Molepske makes arguments in support of the motion. 
Atty Gardner makes arguments in opposition of the motion. 
Atty Molepske makes additional arguments. 
Atty Gardner makes additional arguments. 
Court questions Atty Molepske.

BY THE COURT: If claim of defense, then testimony would not be allowed until rebuttal. Defendant has not objected to so Court will allow that.  Dr. cannot testify as to what the defendant told the doctor.  Court finds the statement to the corporal was a voluntary statement not in response to interrogation and there is no Miranda violation. Statement of the corporal will be allowed as long as it is relevant.

3) Motion for impeachment of convictions
Atty Molepske makes arguments in support of the motion.  
Atty Gardner agrees with 7 convictions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds for purposes of impeachment under prior convictions the proper response will be 7.  They are relevant for credibility reasons. 

4) Motion for admission of defendants statements
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court.  
Court questions Atty Molepske. 
Atty Gardner makes arguments in opposition of the motion. 
Atty Molepske makes additional arguments. 
Atty Gardner makes additional arguments. 

BY THE COURT: 
1 (a) - Court will allow the statement as it goes to the DC charge directly.   Goes to issues and context to the circumstances and is highly relevant outweighs prejudicial fact. 
1 (b) - No objection by the parties.  Is allowed. 
1 (c) - No objection by the parties.  Is allowed. 
1 (d) - Court finds it is relevant and is not unduly prejudicial and Court will allow the statement. 
2 - Court allows those statements. 
3 - No longer needed
4 - Previously addressed.  Statements are admitted. 

Atty Molepske asks that motions in limine be heard before trial. 
Atty Gardner makes statements re: defendants attire.  Not requesting any other unusual 

BY THE COURT:  THe defendant is to appear unshackled and in street clothes.  If there are security risks, that can be dealt with outside the presence of the jury. 
If there are other Motions in Limine, parties are to let the Court know. 

Atty Gardner requests all witnesses be sequestered. 
BY THE COURT: All witnesses are sequestered with the exception of the officer Uitenbroeck or Kussow of  the Stevens Point Police Department at the State's table. 

Atty Molepske makes statements regarding scheduling a status re: witnesses that are required to appear.  If they do not appear, a bench warrant would be issued or on the day of trial without the jury's presence, that process would be gone thru.   One of the State's witnesses have not been available for trial prep.  Having problems even accomplishing service of the witness. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will schedule this for an Order to Appear on November 4, 2014 but will not do the jury trial that date.  There are other trials scheduled.  If the witnesses do not appear on the 4th, Court anticipates the State having to dismiss the file.  

Atty Gardner makes additional statements with regards to objecting. 
Atty Molepske makes statements for clarification. 

14CF284-
Atty Gardner indicates there will be no motion to withdraw by counsel. 
Atty Molepske makes statements.  State did not prepare motions in this case for today. 
Atty Gardner states he does anticipate filing a speedy trial demand. 
This matter is set for a PTC on 11/10/14 at 11:30 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Defendant Patrick J Pirtle in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer B. Hansen is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
Exhibits #1 and #2 are marked on behalf of the plaintiff.
Witness identifies the defendant. 

Atty Molepske moves for the admission of Exhibits #1 and #2.  No objection for purpose of preliminary hearing by Atty Gardner. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibits #1 and #2 are received. 

Cross exam by Atty Gardner.

Atty Molepske makes final arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Atty Gardner stands mute. 
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf. 

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

7/28/14 Court amends the bond from $20,000 cash to $10,000 cash.  All conditions remain the same: 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
No contact direct/indirect with Paul W. Rath or go upon the premises where he resides.

Defendant Patrick J Pirtle appeared by video. Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Gardner does not waive preliminary hearing time limits. 
Atty Gardner makes arguments re: bond.  Asks to amend to a signature bond. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments re: bond. 

BY THE COURT:  Court amends bond to  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/28/14   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1

Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $25,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Court questions defendant further re: trial in August.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
